description: Description

Aloha Dear Friends and Family,The Pascua ohana's lives were forever changed when this devastating Lahaina fire swept through their ancestral home, leaving behind nothing but ashes and memories. Wilbert and Malia are a ray of light to everyone they come across. They are the most selfless individuals we have ever known. They are reliable and will drop everything to help someone in a heart beat. They are parents to 5 beautiful children, Shay, Jaeden, Lawai'a, Konalia and their miracle baby Ku'u. We are committed to using the funds raised to secure a safe haven for their family, a place where they can heal, dream, and rebuild their lives. Your generosity will provide more than a roof over their heads; it will gift the family a second chance and a reminder that compassion knows no bounds.

If you know christine and fano you know they are the most loving and giving folks around. They love purely and fiercely. We want to ease their burden and provide financial support and help them get back on their feet.

We are helping to raise money for our family who fell victim of the most recent Maui Lahaina fire tragedy that happened today. This fire has resulted in them losing everything including their home, cars, and all other belongings. As they had to evacuate with nothing but the clothes on their back. They‚Äôre a family of 5 with a college student who was home for the summer. If there is anyway that you can help it is very appreciated. Prayers for the family are also very appreciated!

Aloha, my name is Macy Catalano, and I‚Äôm raising funds for the Arakawa ‚ÄòOhana. They, like many, lost their family home, belongings, and memories in this catastrophic fire which has burned down our entire hometown. Over the last 30 years, they grew their family and lives in the heart of Lahaina. Both parents Douglas and Lori Arakawa have called this house on Waine‚Äôe Street their home since the early 90‚Äôs. Doug attended and graduated from Lahainaluna Highschool, along with both of his children Austin and Amanda. As integrated parts of their community, the Arakawa family is devastated by the loss of not just their belongings, but their neighborhood, and our beloved Lahaina. They are currently safe, but have no where to go or call home.

Aloha everyone, my name is Emma Lyn Adolpho and I've started this go fund me in hopes of helping my aunty Gigi Mano and her 'ohana, who have lost everything but each other to the Lahaina fire. My Aunty and her  ªohana moved to Lahaina in 1997 to family land and resided there since. My Aunty, her daughter Nakala, son in law Keoni, and eight of her grandchildren (oldest 26 years old, youngest 17 months old) lived right there in the heart of Lahaina on Luakini street. Their home on Luakini housed generations of the Mano  ªohana and held many memories and loved ones, some who had passed prior to the fire. The ashes of her husband Larry (Lionel) Mano deceased (2013), and four year old granddaughter Kaiohu Kapu who passed in 2014 is now apart of the land where the house once stood.

Many of you might be wondering if the legendary surfboard shaper Bob ‚ÄúOle‚Äù Olson survived the fires. Yes...he just made it out alive with the help of a young couple that helped Bev get him into their car. They grabbed the cats and dog and not much else. He has lost his home, shaping room/business, and storage unit . In the dash out the door even his hearing aids and glasses were left behind. Can you imagine starting from scratch at 93 years old? As we are all wondering how can we help, this would be a worthy cause to donate to! I hope that the community can kokua and help him to land on his feet. He has shared the stoke with so many surfers with his longboards over the decades that I hope we can all help him now.

My name is Desiree Vasquez, I‚Äôve been truly blessed to be raised up in such a tight knit community called Lahaina. We are so so grateful to know our home was one of the few in our neighborhood that was spared, but it is not livable and for the safety of ourselves along with our kids we had to make the decision to leave Lahaina & we do not know when we will be able to return to our home. We are so thankful to have been taken in by some family members for the time being.Your support in helping our family get through this life changing experience is greatly appreciated. The funds raised will be utilized to provide relief for temporary shelter, clothing, and food.

I'm starting this on behalf of my friend Deborah. She has lost her home at Baby beach and all of the things that she needs to run her business Maui Dolce. Beautiful Caftans and dresses. Debra has been an artisan on Maui for nearly a decade and apart of the Maui swap meet, Lahaina Civic Center, and Maui's best craft fair community. Please help her get the basic things that she needs.

This is Cinthia Guadarrama's family. She is our beloved cleaner in Maui. She and her family had less than 5 min to run from the fires that devastated Lahaina. They are struggling with trauma and figuring out how to handle basic needs. They have nothing but the clothes on their backs. We offered our condo but for now it has no electricity or water. Cinthia's husband joined her cleaning business and now they both have to start from scratch. Their work vehicle burned, all their linens, cleaning supplies and equipment. Many of their clients lost their rentals, so once they get back on their feet they will have less income.Cinthia embodies everything about the aloha spirit. She is one of most genuinely kind people you could ever meet.

Hi, I am Taylor Panlasigui (Antonio Jr, Lee-Ann, Taylor, Ross, and Rayn) and we are on eof the families who lost our homes. Any donations will help us rebuild what we lost. We are just devastated. This support and everyone's love has been amazing!

Evin and Donna Blanco have lived on Luakini St. for such an immense time they are staples of the Front St. community. Donna worked for Pioneer Inn for YEARS and eventually even moved onto management after the Papa'aina renovation. Evin worked at the Baya Bowls food truck on Waine'e, which was locally owned and walking distance from their beautiful home.They are still looking for their 3 beloved cats, Mochi, Bunny, and Saucy.

My family members in Lahaina lost their 7 bedroom home. They are asking for help to purchase bedding, sheets, blankets, pillows - but they have also lost expensive medical supplies (i.e. dialysis machine). Anything you can spare will help.

We lost everything in the Lahaina fires. We lived on the property of the Lahaina Jodo Mission. My brother and I both grew up on the West side of Maui starting from Children of the Rainbow, Holy Innocents', to Lahainaluna graduates. After years of working on Front St., my parents were finally able to sell their art starting post-COVID. We lost all of our art in the fire, our business, and countless ireeplaceable family treasures.

Aloha family and friends, we, the children of Lenward Kamake‚Äôeaina, are starting this fundraiser to help our father and his family get back on their feet. Sadly, our father, along with his family and his in-laws, have lost their house and all of their possessions. With little time to evacuate, his wife was only able to get our two sisters, their pets and herself out of the house. Leaving behind everything, they are left with little to no clothes, barely any baby essentials for our one-year-old sister and lost all the supplies for our 10-year-old sister who was about to start her new school year. Any type of kokua would be greatly appreciated at this time.

Heriberto Negrete Cardenas, Jose Cardenas, and Claudia Cardenas. My name is Heriberto. Most people in Lahaina know me as Eddie. My family and I live at the bottom of Lahainaluna Road near Paunau Park. Like man others due to this horrible fire my home was one of the homes that did not make it leaving us with nothing but the clothes we had on and a dew shirts I grabbed running out with my dog.
My parents lost everything due to the fire that occurred in Lahaina. They lived alone. My mother is the one who helps me take care of my 2 girls.

my name is lizet sanchez. last august 8th unfortunately we lost everything due to the big fire that happened in lahaina... our family of 4 including 2 babies of 13 months and 4 months thank god we are fine and nothing happened to the babes. only material losses

Aloha family and friends, these are my parents, Soane and Kalota Fauhiva, & my younger brother Teddy. I‚Äôm starting this go fund me to help support my family. They lived on Front Street in Lahaina, Maui. On Wednesday, August 9, 2023, their home along with everything else they owned was lost in the fire. Although I live in the mainland, I‚Äôm doing all I can to help them with the things they stand in need of. Basic necessities and medications are priority. The funds raised here will go directly to them, in helping them to stabilize and rebuild their lives.

My name is Shawn-Yvler Pasalo and my family lived in a beautiful town called Lahaina located in Maui since 1996. My family was affected by the outrageous wildfires that burned our hometown, homes, and jobs down. I‚Äôm fundraising to help my family make money because we are in a rough situation right now, and with the money we will save up for a new home. Thankfully my family is back together after being separated for a couple of days. Thank God that our family is safe.
Akanesi Vaa and her family made it safety along with the Grandmother and baby that asked for their help.

Greetings, our comrades in Maui are in dire need of assistance. Perhaps some of you are familiar with Contra Mestre Fabio and his unwavering commitment to the Maui community. Both he and a handful of his disciples have been left with nothing. On top of that, he lost his business. Join us in expressing compassion and providing aid during this distressing period. Every cent donated will be directly allocated to their recovery.

Aloha, on behalf of the Constantino, Domingo, & Mendoza Ohana I humbly ask for your support during this difficult time. My family who I have created this gofund me for has lost everything and some still unaccounted for. I am niece, cousin, and aunt to them and would like to help in any way possible. Like many others they left their home on foot due to their neighborhood being engulfed with no chance to escape by vehicle! Barely making it out, with the grace of god they were able to make it to Puamana where a Good Samaritan offered them a ride out of Lahaina and into kahului. They left behind everything, but are grateful to be alive with the terrors of what seemed like an apocalyptic scene or bombing of our home town! We are still hanging onto hope for our loved ones Allen Constantino & Leticia (Letty) Constantino as they are still unaccounted for. & ask that if you have any information please contact us.

In the face of this tragic loss, our hearts ache for the incredible staff of the Lahaina Christmas Store ‚Äì Edwin Delaney, Jen Miller, Kaye Pagpacan, Perlita Tapanan, and Editha Portugal, many lost their homes and belongings in the flames, barely escaping with their lives. As the daughter of the owner of the Lahaina Christmas Store, I‚Äôve had the honor of witnessing the magic and joy the store brought to countless lives from around the world. If you‚Äôve had the opportunity to experience the wonder of the store, you understand the immense happiness and countless memories that were made within its walls.100% of all proceeds will go directly to Edwin, Jen, Kaye, Perlita and Editha, offering them a lifeline with the support they need to start rebuilding their lives.

My family and I (Rose Nakamiyo, Paulette Vee, Susan Kealoha, Jill Sprott) have set up a family Venmo account with the help of our cousins,  Alton DeGama Sr. & Richelle Kekona, to assist our 10 families who have lost it all in the fires. The proceeds for this account will be evenly distributed amongst all 10 families. Those affected are: Valene Casco & Family, Eric Casco & Family, Kai Castro & Family, Alton DeGama Sr., Alton DeGama Jr. & Family, Kevin Fujimoto & Family, Lehua Li & Family, Shannon Li & Family, Lilian Suter, & Brandi Tartios. Let‚Äôs show our affected loved ones that together, families stand strong.  Through our unity, love, and compassion, our Castro ‚ÄòOhana will persevere.  Together our positive impact will make a difference and restore hope.  Cousins are connected heart to heart ‚Äì distance and time can never break them apart! Your generosity will be greatly appreciated and will go a long way helping our family who are facing the aftermath of this tragedy.  Thank you for your consideration and support. If you do not have a Venmo and would like to donate, please reach out and we will assist in other ways.

Hi my name is Silvana Palencia I am the step mom of Jacqueline Chirino Cruz. She is one of many others who lost their homes to the Lahaina fire. The fires in Lahaina not only burnt down EVERYTHING it burnt down the home she grew up in. Jacqueline‚Äôs childhood has always been Lahaina. She was about to start college pretty soon but with these devastating time it will be hard for her n her family to get back up. If you are able to help, please consider donating to Jacqueline and family in their time of need.

Anyone who lives in Lahaina and has a long genealogy there know Aunty Louella Haia. She's everyone's Aunty/Mommy. The day of the fire a tree fell down taking along a utility pole with it blocking their driveway as the flames were roaring across the street. They were able to get out with help of family and freinds just in time. Aunty Louella is a caretaker of her brother Charles Haia and he is disabled and blind. I know times are tough and many need aid, but these are the most generous people.

family_name: Dela Cruz Family (Florence, Floribelle, Foilan, Jane, AJ, Mae, Lily, Oreo)
description: Aloha, My name is Florence. I am creating this to help my family who have lost there home due to the Lahaina fire. First and foremost I am grateful that my family including our extended ohana are all safe! The fire that ravished the beautiful community of Lahaina(where I also grew up) has burned our family home. My mom, dad,brother(Froilan), sister in law(Jane), nephew(AJ) my sister(Mae)and niece(Lily) and Oreo(fur baby)lived in the home. With no indication of what this devastating fire would create, my brother and sister in law had to flee with AJ, Lily and Oreo. Like many they were not able to bring anything with them as this was unexpected. The funds will help them with basic needs and to get back on there feet. We appreciate and thank you!

Hi I‚Äôm fundraising for my brother who lost everything in the Lahaina, Maui fires 8/8-8/9. He only has the clothes on his back, the home he was renting is completely gone along with his job, a famous restaurant, Fleetwoods, on Front Street. He is a generous, hardworking, compassionate, kind person who is well loved by everyone. I started this for him to survive and help him get on his feet again.

Hi, I'm Sabrina and I'm fundraising for my brother Shaun Collins and his girlfriend Laura Cole. They lost everything in the Lahaina fire like so many did. Shaun moved to Lahaina in July 2018 after buying a wedding planning company.  He packed up his entire life in Oregon where he grew up and shipped everything that mattered to him over to Maui to start his new chapter. That chapter started roughly when our dad unexpectedly passed away a week after he moved to Hawaii. Shaun began his wedding planning business after returning from Oregon (for our dad's celebration of life) and worked at Foodland Farms in Lahaina before getting a job with HFA (distributing food to stores in Lahaina). When covid hit in 2020, the wedding planning business was put on hold (since no tourists were allowed for so long). Shaun and Laura met in March 2019. Laura had been on Maui for years and is very loved by many in the theater community and works at local schools as a teacher (4th grade the last two years). They need money to rebuild their lives in Maui.

Among those who lost everything, we learned that in our own family, 7 family homes were destroyed. All funds raised will be sent to our cousin Leo in Wailuku, Maui, who will take everything we receive and distribute it equally among our 7 families to help meet their immediate and urgent needs. Lahaina has been the family home on my dad‚Äôs side for generations. My childhood we spent many summers in Lahaina deepening our relationship with aunties, uncles and cousins and learning about our Hawaiian culture and roots; which I am eternally grateful to my parents as well as my aunties and uncles. These are the cousins, aunties and uncles we are wanting to bless.

On behalf of his fellow crewmembers, we are fundraising for Ray and his family who have lost everything due to the fires in Lahaina. Ray is the most kindhearted, selfless individual who loves his family more than anything. He splits his time between Maui & New York, sacrificing being away from home so he can work & help his parents with additional expenses as he also has a special needs brother. Although he & his family are both prideful & humble, they are having a difficult time accepting help. However, given this circumstance, I know they would graciously appreciate any support & comfort they can get.

My name is Glen Pascual and I am fundraising on behalf of my family. I never thought I would ever have to do this, but I am starting this gofundme to humbly ask for your help. Our family has been affected by the wildfire that devastated my beloved hometown of Lahaina, Maui on August 8, 2023. Our family home was destroyed in the fire. Our 90 year-old mother Natividad Pascual barely escaped with her life. But thanks to God and many angels, she is still alive and staying here with me in Wailuku. My brother Macario and his family, Karen, Nick and Evan are safe but sheltering at home in Honokowai. They‚Äôve been without power, and phone and cell service have been sporadic since Tuesday. My Mom was evacuated to the Lahaina Civic Center shelter, where she was seen by EMTs for her eye injuries and small burns from the flying embers and ash. There, she was able to be transported by ambulance to Maui Memorial Medical Center where I was able to reunite with her at 3 a.m. Thank God. We truly believe that our Dad in Heaven was protecting our Mom. The Pascual roots are firmly planted in Lahaina and we will never leave. We hope to one day enjoy the bounty from the marungay tree that my Dad planted back in 1969. The base of the tree still appears to be there ‚Äì I am confident that it will recover as will our family and all of Lahaina. We appreciate anything you can give. Mahalo and thank you!

This fundraiser is to help provide aid to my father through this transition and eventually restart his business. Funds will help replace lost artwork, material, frames, and other artist equipment. Irreplaceable photos dating back to the late 70's, all of which documented Lahaina's history and served as the source of inspiration and reference for my father's work, were destroyed. These funds will also help buffer the loss of income to continue paying bills, food, and other essential necessities as we navigate through these uncharted, trying times. There are countless families in need of help, we are grateful for your consideration and support in any form. We hope to see you all soon and continue the legacy of Lahaina.

Daniela was an artist in Lahaina where she has been residing for the past 15 years. She ran a hair salon from her home on Ilikahi st where it all burned down along with all her art work. Any donations will be appreciated ü§é

Aloha - we lost our home and everything in it. We were grateful to escape minutes prior to the fire. I have a 10 month old son named Banyan. Every night we rode our bikes down to the Banyan tree for sunset. We are grateful the Banyan tree is still standing and have hope it will rise from the ashes. Please support our Ohana and rebuilding our life for our sweet Banyan Boy - Peter, Alexa, and Banyan Cummings

My name is George Wilson. My mom's family is from Lahaina, Maui. Her dad, my grandfather, grew up there and a good chunk of my Ohana lives there today, including her sister and the majority of her first cousins. Our family is incredibly tight. Many of my 2nd and 3rd cousins are like brothers and sisters to me. When situations like these happen, it's only natural for our family to come together to help support our loved ones. My aunty, Kanoe Keahi, lived across the street from the Lahaina Cannery, about a neighborhood over from Lahainaluna road. Her house, like so many others, was decimated in flames. Her dog wasn't able to get out and all they have are the clothes on their backs and they are currently houseless. With that being said, this go fund me is dedicated to her and her Ohana to help on this long road of rebuilding their lives. Full transparency, money raised here will be given directly to her. I've already started collecting donations of all sorts to send help directly to our family currently stuck in Lahaina. Friends of mine were generous enough to donate monetarily and I've personally collected nearly $1800 and counting via Venmo, that will be donated directly to my Aunty to help in getting her and her family clothes and necessities and long term help to get their lives figured out.

Aloha, Sean and I are born and raised Lahaina residents. We we‚Äôre very lucky to have escaped with our cat, leaving behind our home, belongings, vehicle, as well as my fathers ashes who passed this past March. I know that we will rebuild and I will be able to get more things but his belongings I will never be able to replace. Mahalo for your consideration

family_name: Ke‚Äòeaumoku & Uilani Kapu of Na 'Aikane O Maui Cultural Center
description: Na ‚ÄòAikane o Maui Cultural Center destroyed in Lahaina fire- Ke‚Äòeaumoku Kapu, head of the cultural center and caretaker of the property. The Lahaina fire destroyed lives, residences, businesses and many culturally significant locations and beloved spots of the old Hawaiian fishing village.The losses include Front Street‚Äôs iconic banyan tree, a fishpond and the Na ‚ÄòAikane o Maui Cultural Center.Located in the heart of town on touristy Front Street, the two-story cultural center was a place where the Hawaiian community could gather to talk about issues facing their people, look at Polynesian artifacts, historical documents, maps and a place to provide meals.‚ÄúThat is all gone,‚Äù said Ke‚Äòeaumoku Kapu, head of the cultural center and caretaker of the property. ‚ÄúThe place is burnt down to the ground.‚Äù

Long time Lahaina Family who coached youth sports and housed so many local children. They always opened their door for everyone and made sure we were always fed. This selfless hardworking family is always giving and I hope we can show our aloha in anyway.

My brother and family friends have lost everything in the Maui fires. They spent years working "hands on" to build their home and property into an amazing place for raising kids and bringing ohana together. They had finally done it and been able to enjoy it with loved ones for only a few years before it was all wiped out just days ago. While that was an unimaginable loss all that matters to them is getting back on their feet for the girls. I'm grateful for anything you can give to help them help each other do just that.Cam, Jeremiah, Danielle, Josie & Poppy

I'm May. I lost everything in the fire. Don't know what the next step in life is. I'm safe. So grateful to be alive. We survived the apocalypse. Everyone told me to get a GoFundMe so here we are.Anything helps at this point..Thank you all for the love and generosity.I'm overwhelmed with gratitude for our community We will rebuild.

family_name: Isaac Bancaco & Efforts To Feed & Help Lahaina Community through World Centric Kitchen
description: I'm starting this page on behalf of Isaac Bancaco who has been working tirelessly to support other Lahaina wildfire victims since the moment he lost his home and his business (Pacific'o on the Beach). Thankfully his boat, truck and OC1 were safe, but everything else including his business is completely gone.Isaac has been selflessly dedicating his time and fundraising efforts to @chefhui through fundraising and daily trips into Lahaina to ensure survivors receive warm, fresh meals daily in collaboration with World Centric Kitchen.

Hello my name is Chelsie Tau-a and I have a family of 4, my fianc√© Corey Powell and our boys 5year old Makkel and 7 year old Malik. We were living at the KHAKO Lahaina shelter for about 2 years up until the Lahaina fire. From the reports we've found, our unit and all of the other buildings on the property were burned to the ground along with everything we own. We were lucky enough to escape with a small duffel bag of clothes. I have started a gofundme to help us recover a portion of what was lost and I've started a Venmo as well. I will link both below thank you! We can be listed as Tau-a Ohana. Please let me know if there is a discrepancy with the vetting process as I kept my life very private during the last couple of years for safety reasons and I will provide a letter of verification from KHAKO shelter thank you very much!

My name is Lauren Yee (I am from O'ahu), I am organizing this fund on behalf of my close college friend Janeen Higuchi and her Aunt Lynette Ruppert. They suddenly lost their home, valuables, and two cats in the devastating fire that went through their hometown of Lahaina, Maui on August 8th. This was Janeen's childhood home and I can't imagine how it must feel to lose a home filled with so many memories. Thankfully Janeen was able to evacuate safely and her Aunt was not in Lahaina at the time of the fire.Your monetary donation will support any emergency expenses, living essentials, and any additional needs in the coming days. Mahalo for taking the time to read their story and for supporting Janeen and her Aunt.

My name is Tehani Kuhaulua the oldest grandchild of Donna Gomes making this campaign on behalf of my immediate family members. As we all know about the horrifying drastic life-changing event that took place on August 8th, 2023. Along with many other long-term LAHAINA GROWN residents, we as well have lost everything. Not only have we lost our homes but our family is also grieving the loss of our family backbone DONNA L GOMES. We do not usually ask for assistance. However, making a GoFundMe is out of our comfort zone. During this critical time, we are in desperate need of anything you can give. Nothing

Our very own team members have been devastatingly affected and have completely lost their homes and livelihoods. Kesha, Jireh, and Nicole were not only a part of the Maui Matcha team but they are considered family to us. The flames consumed everything they held dear ‚Äì cherished memories, personal belongings, and the place they called home. The funds raised will go directly to them and will help cover immediate essentials like clothing, shelter, and necessities.Additionally, they will aid in the daunting task of starting anew ‚Äì from finding a new place to live to replacing everyday items that were lost in the fire.

Our Ohana, the Marzan's, in Lahaina are all safe, but unfortunately, they have lost their homes and all their belongings. Just weeks before the fire happened, his son Ola (10), was diagnosed with leukemia, and has been spending their time with ongoing treatments at Kapiolani Medical Center for Women and Children. His home, below, has also been destroyed. We pray and ask for your kokua during these tragic times. Your donations are greatly appreciated!100% of the monies will go directly to our Ohana and will be divided amongst them.
Laakea ‚ÄúJonah‚Äù is an employee of Hyatt Resort in Kaanapali. Also lost his home!

Hi my name is Marissa and I am creating this for Kelson Kihe aka Kihe because I know he never will. He is prob going to be mad at me for doing this, but I feel it in my heart it‚Äôs necessary. Kihe is considered family to many and he is a beloved part of the LƒÅhainƒÅ community. You prob won‚Äôt meet a person that lives in LƒÅhainƒÅ that doesn‚Äôt know him especially within Front St. and the fishing/ boat/ surfing community. He is one of the most generous selfless humans I know. He goes above and beyond for anyone and everyone. He will give the shirt off his back and spend his last dollar on the next person without a 2nd thought. He‚Äôs a captain and fisherman who lost his boat which is his business and main source of income. Since the disaster he has been in LƒÅhainƒÅ on the scene everyday all day non stop doing what he does best helping people.So pls help me help someone that will never ask for it. This is a way for you to donate directly. This donation won‚Äôt only help him but his crew, and ppl close to him that are in dire need as well.
Kimo is a longtime resident of Lahaina and integral part of the Maui Surf Culture surf school that was on Prison St. He lost his home.

I‚Äôm Paul Henry and Jessie Whitmore is a long time friend of mine and like hundreds of people in Hawaii lost literally everything she owned in a matter of minutes. This was the picture that was sent to me minutes before the fire consumed her home in Lahaina. I told her to get out asap. She was one of the lucky ones. She was able to pack one bag and get out alive. Many others near her are gone and or still missing. We pray for them all and safe return. Please consider giving anything you possibly can. She has nothing but the clothes on her back and is currently living in her jeep. If you know me, I would not ask unless it was needed. Thanks for considering and god bless all of the people of Hawaii affected by this tragic incident.

Hi my name is Samantha Shibao, I lived right behind the mill before disaster struck. My father is Terry Shibao and he is one of the coaches for the LahainaLuna wrestling team. We need help to get back on our feet. Our beautiful plantation time home was unfortunately burnt down by the massive fire along with all of our valuable and sentimenal belongings. with our home being gone by the fire, my mother Cynthia Shibao lost her workplace [Holy Innocence Preschool]. Any donation no matter what size will go to rebuilding everything we lostMahalo and thank-you for your time

*Donations will be in euro because she is in europe fundraising for her family*  My name is Franeo Rodrigo, nephew of Nicholas Calucag and Elizabeth Alipio, and I am starting this fundraiser on behalf of my Uncle and Auntie that have lost their family home and everything they own in the Lahaina wildfire. Due to the fire, they are currently without a home as well as a source of income, we therefore kindly ask for any donations, and your generosity will ensure them food and shelter. Although we are unable to replace all the countless memories, we hope to make this transition as bearable as possible, despite the conditions.Any amount would be greatly appreciated, every little helps. Whatever you believe in, please pray for them and the community of Lahaina. Mahalo, God bless & good health.

My Uncle Chuck is a Maui resident of 40+ years who like many, after trying to escape the flames in his vehicle, narrowly escaped the flames on foot. Chuck is in his mid 70s and suffers from diabetes that can affect his mobility. We are so grateful that he survived when so many did not. However, he's lost his home, possessions and vehicle to the flames.Many want to help and Chuck is so grateful. He's loves Maui and does not want to leave. Thankfully, he has temporary shelter with a friend but will only be able to stay there for so long. Our family's hope is that these funds will help him start to replace and rebuild what has been lost and he can stay on the island he loves.All funds raised will go directly to Chuck. If you prefer to give in another way, please reach out to myself, my uncle Michael or my dad Henri.

Hello, my name is Evanjovi. Unfortunately my family was affected by the Maui wildfires this week. Fortunately, we are safe but lost our home and everything within it. We are expecting a baby and he is going to be born any day now.We'd really appreciate any donation possible. Money donated will go to housing, food, and medical expenses. If you have any donations for a newborn (diapers, clothes, etc.) we will take those as well.Any money contributed will be sent directly to my family and me to help get us through this tough time. Thank you in advance and please keep the whole island in your prayers!

My name is Bistra and I lost everything in Lahaina fires. All material belongings that I used to have are gone, just a backpack with a few pairs of clothes have left.I am so grateful that I am well and alive, overwhelmed by the love and support I have received. As they navigate the arduous journey of recovery, we aim to provide them with the resources and assistance necessary to emerge from this tragedy stronger than ever. My name is Tom Kitaguchi. I am humbly starting this gofundme in hopes that I can aid my family and help them find some sense of security during this devastating time. It pains me to say that my brother who also resided with them there, Albert Kitaguchi, has still not been located since the night of 8/8. In efforts to look for my brother, my daughter drove through active fire/power lines/thick black smoke with little visibility on two separate occasions the night of the fire, and watched our home engulfed in flames. My mother, Wanda Kitaguchi, immigrated from Japan to Lahaina in 1953, alongside my Lahaina born father, James S. Kitaguchi (departed). So many memories, so much blood, sweat, and tears, countless irreplaceable family photo albums and memorabilia, journals upon journals of daily logs that my mom would write every evening, all of her "broke da mouth" recipes she has spent her whole life collecting from different people and places, gone into the ashes and rubble before they even knew it. Beyond the material things, our Wahikuli home held so much more meaning, history, and depth. Funds earned will go toward providing basic essential items, hotel stay costs, and potentially reestablishing their home in the far future.

My name is Robert Chang III (Ekolu) and like so many on August 8, 2023 we lost nearly everything due to the Maui Wildfire. Hello everyone, my name is Erin and I‚Äôm a former Pita Jungle employee and an all-around Matt enthusiast. Aloha and thank you for stopping by and reading my brother's story. On August 8th, 2023 in Lahaina, Maui, hurricane Dora passed south of the Hawaiian islands and brought widespread devastation from high winds and wildfires that destroyed everything in its path. My brother, his girlfriend and their dog were woken up from the smoke, flames and screams. Very confused and scared, they tried to get out of the area as fast as possible, but were met in gridlock with other vehicles. They barely made it out of the area alive. With no gas and damage to their van, they walked to kaanapali until they kept being told to move out towards Honokowai. They waited for days with no help. With no sleep, food and barely any water, they made a desperate decision to go back on foot to siphon gas from abandoned cars so they could hopefully drive back out to town. There was no warning that the fires were spreading quickly and we‚Äôre thankful that they are ok.

I am Scottie‚Äôs sister Jennifer and I am reaching out to you with a heavy heart during these devastating times. If you are able to help, please consider donating to Scottie and Brittany in their time of need.

Hi, I'm Neil and my grandmother was affected by the Lahaina Fire. Aloha, my name is Paul Tralka, I am raising money for my brother, his wife, and their young family that lost their home up on Akeke Place in Lahaina. After many years of slowly renovating and budget rebuilding, all while growing their family (having 3 children) they finally reached a point where they were comfortable and not sleeping in a construction zone. They entertained visitors and shared their space with many friends and co-workers. Although Andrew and Jaclyn are safe and surrounded by family and support, I set up this Crowdfund for them, as they are too emotional at the moment. Aloha! As most of you know, our family lost our home to the tragic fires in Lahaina town. We lost all material possessions but are extremely grateful our family made it out safe. Hello all- our dear friends, Norman and Cambria Russell, their son Rio and daughter Asia have been displaced from their home in Lahaina indefinitely due to the Wildfires on August 8. My name is Aubrey Ahana and my grandma, Theresa Shim lost her home on August 8th, 2023 due to the ferocious Lahaina Wildfires. Hello everyone my name is Grace & I am fundraising for my parents Jen & Randy Mcnamee. On August 8th my parents were impacted immensely by the wildfires that tore through Lahaina and burnt their house to the ground. My parents lived in south Lahaina on Front st, with our two loving sweet yellow labradors Molly & Dakota. They are mom and daughter ages 9 & 5. My mom ran a wonderful business from home supplying families in need with baby items which is what brought her to Lahaina. She was previously living in Makawao but moved to Lahaina due to how well her business was doing on the west side. The morning the fires broke out my mom was doing business in Kahului trying to get baby seats to a visiting family. They were trying to rush home, but when they reached the Maui ocean center they were met with road closures and traffic making it impossible to get home. My parents lost everything, clothes, medicine, food, pictures, and so much more. 100% of the money raised will be going towards my parents to aid them with the rescue of our dogs, medicine, clothing, food, and basic essentials they need.

Makayla and TJ both narrowly escaped this tragedy. The flames were outside their windows in an instant. They grabbed whatever they could hold and left everything else behind. Aloha mai kakou. O wau o Kameaaloha Laborte, he kama no Lele au. (Aloha everyone. My name is Kameaaloha Laborte, I am a child of Lele - the old name for Lahaina). My name is Cindy (Ching) and my dad (born in 1917), along with his brothers and sisters, was born and raised in Lahaina where they had a family store along Front Street in the 1930s. My dear friends Caitlin, Kev, their 6 month old baby Oscar, and their dog, Phoebe, lost everything but each other in the Lahaina fire on August 8th, 2023. They are currently displaced and mourning the loss of their home and cat, Malu. They owned a scuba diving business called Banyan Tree Divers for 10 years. Their business also helped spread the message of ocean conservation and local activism. This was their first home. They have opened that home and their hearts to so many of us. Trinity Hobdey, the amazing shop manager of LahAina Surf Shack, fled her beloved Fleming home with only her car and the clothes on her back. The revered Fleming home Trinity shared with her ohana (roomies Luca, Ronnie, Micah, Jake, Leonard, Kala, and Zuzu) was burned to the ground by the Lahaina, Maui wildfires on the evening of August 8, 2023. Like so many others, Trinity lost everything, including her cherished surfboards and other seafaring equipment, furniture, clothing, shoes, bicycle, electronics, toiletries, vital record documents, etc. With the exception of her car, the clothes on her back, and a few donations she has since received, everything Trinity owned is gone. We are very lucky to have Trinity safe and with us today. For the past two years, she has dedicated her life to managing and growing the LahAina Surf Shack. Trinity considers her surf instructors, students, and their families as her ohana (family). Trinity coordinated and supported the families of the keiki (children's) programs at the surf shop; she also served as a community organizer for beach cleanups. Trinity has been part of the convoys transporting resources around the island, and as of Saturday, August 12, 2023 Trinity is now volunteering with the Red Cross in their community centers. She is also working to organize an ice pack exchange so that all of those displaced will have a way to keep their coolers cold. Maui is Trinity's life; there is nowhere else she calls home. Immediate needs include housing, a new laptop, and a surfboard - much needed for mental health!

This fundraiser is being organized by Andrew Webb for my brother, Nick, sister-in-law Leianna, and their 6 kids - Kauila, La‚Äôa Kea, Alaula, N≈çweo, K≈çnane, and K≈´‚Äôena. Hello, my name is Trey Thompson, and I would like your help to support the Lahaina Maui Wave Ohana.Lahaina Maui Wave Riders has been a part of Lahaina since 1997. Visitors and locals alike would come through the shop to talk stories, hang out with friends, and learn to surf. Sometimes just to grab a board and paddle out at Breakwall. Kyle took over the business in 2018, and built a culture that prioritized community, caring and friendship. Folks would come from all over and learn to surf with teachers who practice Aloha in every way. When the fires came on August 8, 2023, there was no preparation for the devastation. The shop- ironically an historic building, the old fire station- burned to the ground and reduced to ash. From aerial photos it is clear nothing survived. The employees have lost everything. Most are now homeless and now have lost their livelihoods for the time being. We are thankful that all employees have been accounted for, it is going to be a long road of rebuilding. We learned that Kyle does not have property insurance. He is applying for every federal loan available, but it is not enough. We are devastated that our beloved shop is gone. Any help is so appreciated.

I will be needing surgery very soon due to a spine tumor that‚Äôs making my legs very weak. It was very hard for me to evacuate, I needed help from multiple people. I will need to travel to Oahu for surgery. I want to make my mother‚Äôs life easier for the next few weeks, I don‚Äôt want her to worry about money, only about my recovery.

Aloha. My name is Lauren Parks and with heaviness in my heart, I am asking for your Kokua. Tragedy struck our beautiful Lahaina and even with the amount of guilt I have and devastation caused, I can still thank God that I have still my baby girl, Rachelle. She was flown to Oahu and is being treated for severe burns. Unfortunately, my 18 week old granddaughter that she was carrying did not survive in her womb. Her husband, my son in law Marcus, is still missing. The last she heard from him was him trying to race home to get her. Any donation, great or small, will help us with the road ahead with medical expenses and to rebuild our lives, if even possible. Mahalo

Please kokua if can , if not it‚Äôs okay  a little prayer or a share does just as much for us and our babies . Mahalos mahalos ohana . Stay strong Lahaina!

family_name: Mindi & Ken Cherry (Kamehameha III School Teacher)
description: This is Mindi and Ken Cherry. She‚Äôs a first Grade teacher at Kamehameha III Elementary school that had burnt down. They barely made it out with their 3 kids and dogs.  Their house is destroyed and they can use your help!

My name is Stephanie Han, and on August 8th, my parents Kevin and Michelle were among the many residents who evacuated in a moment's notice as wildfires overtook our beloved hometown of Lahaina, Maui. Leaving with not much more than the clothes on their backs, my parents were forced to abandon their car on Front Street and seek refuge in the ocean as their car was engulfed in flames with the rest of Lahaina town. By the grace of God, my childhood home is still standing. However, it has been deemed uninhabitable due to biohazards in the air and water. It is now completely inaccessible as our neighborhood is obsolete and blocked off by the National Guard.Kevin and Michelle have lost the life they have worked so hard to create in Lahaina. For the past 25 years, they have served the Lahaina community through their family-owned business, Aina Lahaina Taxi. Those who know them would describe them as dedicated, kind, and hardworking individuals who aim to go above and beyond in serving their guests. In losing their vehicle in the fire, they have lost not only their source of transportation but also our family‚Äôs main source of income. The community that Kevin and Michelle dedicated their 25 years of service to is no longer there.

We are a group connected through basketball and friendship who are coming together in support of Maiki Tihada & Cathy Nava of Lahaina Maui. At this time it is uncertain what disaster benefits and insurance will contribute towards rebuilding and loss of income. Knowing Maiki and Cathy, we are sure their focus will be on re-connecting and supporting their Heads UP Basketball contingent, extended family and church community instead of addressing their own needs. That‚Äôs where you can help.

My parents Marivic Agcaoili and Jerry Agcaoili work multiple jobs full time! I‚Äôm kindly reaching out to anyone who could help donate ANYTHING desperately in need of help my parents and siblings are currently living outside of a church in Kahului with nothing but the clothes on their backs! we lost everything within minutes of the fire just like the multiple other families as well that lived in Lahaina including our passports clothes jobs and other important things as well such as birth certificates and social security cards, anything and everything will be humbly and highly appreciated during this tragic time even a penny would mean so much and help out more then you would know even a re-share would mean the world to my Ohana especially my hard-working parents who are already of age to retire THANK YOU ALL!

My little sister with 5 kids had their house burn down in the fire with their car and belongings. She's to proud to ask for help. So I'll ask for her. Her children are wild lovable animals and she is a hardheaded lovable girl.

Friend and family, Mahalo for all the love and support already..I am making this for my mom,3 sisters, and 2 nieces to help rebuild from nothing.As you know already our Beautiful Lahaina hometown is gone along with hundreds of lives lost.we continue to pray and are truly blessed our family is safe. family_name: Galindo Family (Carmen, Pablo, & Kids: Pablo, Issac, & Ivan)
description: Aloha my name is Edson Galindo Crispin, I grew up in Lahaina and currently have family and friends in need of help. Patrick Grady has been a Lahaina resident since he was 2 years old. He is my boat captain and like a father to me. He is known by all of his community because of the good-hearted human he is. family_name: Na Hoaloha Ekolu Employee Fund (Old Lahaina Lu'au, Star Noodle, Leoda‚Äôs Kitchen and Pie Shop)
description: On August 8, 2023, our beloved and historic Lahaina town was devastated by wildfires. Many of our 298 employees have either lost their homes or have been displaced due to this tragedy. While we are fortunate to report that most of our structures still stand; our employees have experienced life-changing losses. The ‚Äòohana at Na Hoaloha Ekolu is a proud and supportive organization that has always put employees and the community first. We have been so blessed to share the aloha at our lu‚Äôau to almost four million guests since 1986, shared amazing meals with many more at Star Noodle and Leoda‚Äôs Kitchen and Pie shop, and have supported countless non-profit organizations through charitable donations and volunteer work during the past 37 years. For generations, Lahaina has been a town known for its pride and resilience. If you want to directly support our employees affected by the recent fires, please consider a donation to this campaign. Me ka ha'aha'a (with Humility), The employees of Old Lahaina Lu'au, Star Noodle, Leoda‚Äôs Kitchen and Pie Shop and Na Hoaloha Ekolu

The funds received here, *which i just updated the goal, will help us to rebuild our apartment and everything inside it that got destroyed, and hopefully replace all I invested to start a new company over the last 3 weeks. *I will also be helping everyone possible in my community with good, clothes and other essential supplies, as I have lived here over 17 years now, and we are ALL in this together.* My roommate, Martine Thompson, and I are currently safe and awaiting temporary living accommodations, and I was asked to keep copies of all receipts for food and these services for possible(?!) reimbursement. We cannot even get into our town to access damages due to the massive destruction and deaths that are perpetually accumulating, as fires are still burning! Please help in any way that you can, and God bless you for even reading this. I know God has a plan, and we will be ok, but as of right this second, we are VERY far from it. Mahalo nui loa, Eric McCumber

Hi, My name is Paulele Valdez Lapota. My grandparents, Taniela Lapota, Delta Wailani Pakaki Lapota, my mom, Moli Lapota, and myself lost my childhood home that my grandparents lived at for 30 years. We have been sleeping in the car the past couple nights. So many in my town lost our homes. We don't have access to housing because there was already a severe shortage of homes in my town. Some of my family members can't go back to work because they lost their workplaces too in the fire. The funds will be used to replace what we lost in the fire. We lost all our clothes, belongings, furniture, kitchen and bathroom things, even important documents. My grandma lost her car that melted in the fire. Please, every little bit helps. We are thankful we made it out alive. Praise the Lord.

description: P≈´nana Leo o Lahaina will need our support! Your contribution, regardless of the amount, will make a tangible difference in our ability to support our limahana and 'ohana.

Hello! My name is Linda Romo Stonestreet and I as well as my extended Romo family are raising funds to help our Romo family on Maui after the devastation of the Maui Wildfire. Their family home of 55 years was destroyed by the ravaging wildfire that tore through the beautiful town of Lahaina. Uncle Remy, Royale and Randal evacuated quickly and sadly had to leave all of their possessions behind. They were also forced to make the heartbreaking decision to leave behind their family pets that included 9 cats (Chong, Shadow, Ghost, Whisper, Stoney, Meanie, Goldie, Tiny and Nanu), 8 chickens and 2 lovebirds (Rocky and Adrian). If you know our Maui family you know that they are always the life of the party, where at any time any one of them can tell the funniest story, makes us laugh with crazy jokes or entertain us with beautiful voices. We understand that many across the island of Maui are dealing with the devastation so any donation given is greatly appreciated. The funds raised will help provide the family with the means to purchase groceries and all other necessities for day-to-day living. It will also give them peace of mind as they try to sort out how they are going to get through this as they start their search for housing and employment.

description: Hi, My name is Joelle and this week we were all hit very hard by the Maui fires whether we have family there, friends etc. My family was hit hard and close to home as my mom's side of the family resides in Lahaina. Hi family and friends near and far this is Maila Peralta Layogan helping Mark and his family who lives in Lahainaluna who lost everything they had. Single mom of 2 +DM victim displaced by wildfires

Aloha, on behalf of our family and West Maui Taxi, LLC, we are humbled and grateful by the words of all of you who checked in on us during the Lahaina wildfires.With the loss of our business and much regret, we will be closing the West Maui Taxi, LLC. Hi my name is Tiffany Taira and I was just able to locate my parents in the Lahaina Fire. They had to evacuate their home immediately, with just the clothes on their backs. I never thought I'd have to make a GoFundMe, but my family has been directly and severely impacted by the Lahaina fire on August 8-9. My name is Tiffany and I'm organizing this fundraiser on behalf of my relatives, who lost their home to the horrific fires that engulfed our beautiful Lahaina town in Maui, HI on August 8. I am extremely grateful that their family of 5 are safe and unharmed but tragically, they have lost not only their house but their livelihoods. Our family has been a part of the Lahaina community for over 30 years, owning a small jewelry shop on Front St for most of that time. Sadly, we had to give up that storefront during the pandemic, and my aunt moved to running her business out of her home. With less than an hour to evacuate, their family was only able to grab their most valuable possessions, leaving behind clothing, merchandise, supplies, documents, and much more. Still recovering from the recent loss of my grandmother who lived with them and anticipating large upcoming college tuition costs for their eldest son, my aunt and her family were already in a tight financial position. It will be a long journey to recovery, so we are asking for donations to help them get back on their feet.

We are still blessed to have our lives as many did not make it out in time! I have some family who live in other parts of the island who can house us for the time being, however all I have is my drivers license and a extra set of clothes. My community is unrecognizable and our hearts are heavy, we lost our homes, schools, churches, historic landmarks, and most heartbreaking lives!! I humbly ask for any amount of donations that will help me and my family recover from this devastating event. Anything and everything helps and is so so appreciated! Mahalo for your kokua!
He lives in Lahaina and lost everything. He works for Reef Dancer. Jonny and I have been friends since we were 12yrs old.

Please share in our efforts to support our family in LƒÅhainƒÅ - my brother Elmer and his wife Shirley, their children and grandchildren, along with Shirley's father Bart and their immediate family. Elmer, Shirley, and Bart were able to safely evacuate, but were not able to save their belongings before the Santiago family house was lost to the fire. They are now safe and staying with family as this tragedy unfolds. Lahaina has been home for the Santiagos and Tolentinos for many generations. Your contributions will help them recover, including essentials like toiletries, food, temporary housing, and basic needs. Thank you for your generosity and kindness.

Aloha, my name is Cassidy sumibcay. I have lost my home and car due to the Lahaina fire. I have lived in Lahaina my whole live and that is all I have ever known. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

I'd like to reach out to all of my 808 supporters who would like to make a donation that will support our LAHAINA COMMUNITY. We'd like to use our restaurant platform and expand our resources to help our Community of Lahaina for all of those families who have lost so much during this disaster. These Donations Will Not Be Used to Rebuild Our Restaurant for there is No Restaurant without putting our Community First! **ALL DONATIONS WILL BE USED TO GIVE BACK TO OUR COMMUNITY**

Honu & Frida's bartender. He's likely served your favorite cocktail or brought you a smile from behind the bar. Our favorite west side surfing bartender has lost everything in the Lahaina fires. Without rental insurance, he has no coverage for replacement and like many, is starting from scratch. Your aloha is greatly appreciated.

Kindly aid our Ohana in this time of great need. Everything we held dear - our residence, our vehicles, our entire existence - has been lost. Back in the early 70s, my mother's aspiration led her to purchase our house. It symbolized her journey from the Philippines to Maui, a dream realized. She generously hosted multiple families from the Philippines who sought to establish new lives here. This haven not only sheltered her children, their partners, and grandchildren but also served as a sanctuary for countless others. Regrettably, the flames have reduced this cherished abode to ashes. We are optimistic that this GoFundMe endeavor will provide the means to progress and guide us through the next chapter of our lives. Your contribution would be immensely valued.

Meet Vicky, daughter of Victor Bellarosa; Victor, Korean War Veteran, helped establish a non-profit in Lahaina, Light Bringers, to help feed the homeless and handicapped for 30 years until his untimely passing earlier this year. Victor and the Bellarosa family have generously given back to the Lahaina community for decades without asking for anything in return. Now, we have the opportunity to help those who have spent their lives helping others. Vicky is a devoted single mother and daughter to A.J., her 10-year-old son, and her elderly mother, age 81. No contribution is too small, and every act of kindness matters. Click the donation link below to join Vicky's journey toward a brighter tomorrow. Your support will send a ripple of positive change that will touch the lives of this generous and resilient family.
She worked at Hard Rock for over 26 years & grew up in Lahaina, she lost everything she had in the fire. Any help is appreciated.

Please consider helping the LaVoie ohana who lost everything in the devastating Lahaina, Maui fires. The destruction caused by these fires has left Miles, Eli, and their two small children, Skyler and Mylo without a place to call home. Miles had just spent the last several years updating their house with his own two hands, and now it‚Äôs gone. With little time to evacuate, they had to leave behind cherished memories and possessions in order to escape the horrific wildfire. We are beyond thankful that they are safe, but are heartbroken for them. Not only was their house completely destroyed, but their ENTIRE town and livelihoods. Miles and Eli have always been two of the most generous, hospitable people and they (along with so many others) are in need of our support now more than ever. Any donation would make a significant difference. Let‚Äôs show them that they are not alone in this devastation.

Aloha, my name is Dheane Galiza. I am the daughter of Daicy Balico and my mom lost their home along with other families from the Lahaina wildfire. My stepdads family has also lost their home as well. We were all separated when the fire started and could not get ahold of each other due to the power outage. My mom, stepdad and little sister did not get out of Lahaina until the day after and they could not locate my stepdads parents. They finally found his parents at the shelter. This is actually the second time my mom experienced losing her home to a fire. Back in 2018 she lost her home from a fire in Lahaina. Please help my family. They all left their homes with the clothes on their backs and everything is gone. My mom, little sister, stepdad, grandparents and I need your help and we appreciate any donations and prayers.

My name is Jasmine, my brother Joey & his wife Kele-Jo Kahai along with his daughter Kloey, their home was burnt down on Tuesday evening. They are both hard working people. They lost everything. If you find it in your heart to give please do anything helps. We mahalo you from the bottom of our hearts.

Our parents, Freddie and Ericka Gaastra, have called Maui and the Westside community home for nearly 30 years. We're heartbroken to write that they've lost their home in the recent Lahaina fire along with so many more people. In this absolutely unprecedented moment, we are asking for your support. Anything you can offer would mean the world to us. Your contributions will be used to secure temporary housing for our parents, provide essential clothing and supplies, and help us lay the foundation for rebuilding our cherished home and livelihood. Your generosity is deeply appreciated.

My name is Challys Pascual, and I am writing this on behalf of my stepfather, mother, and grandparents. With fire nearly trapping the traffic of cars, my family made the quick decision to turn around to go towards Central Maui. With downed traffic lights, power lines, trees, and thick, blinding smoke, we barely made it out of Lahaina. Had we not done this, we would have been among the many people that had to abandon their cars and jump into the ocean for safety. Since coming to Wailuku, photos show that our home and town has turned to rubble. We are grateful to be alive and reunite with my grandparents, whom we didn't locate until a day later. However, we can only fend for ourselves with the money we have in our pockets and banks for so long. The more days that pass, the more our survival becomes a financial burden. Please consider donating any ounce of money to our family. This will go towards hopefully rebuilding our house (whenever that is possible), repurchasing valuables lost in the fire, pet food and supplies, and other necessary items. Thank you for all of the prayers, thoughts, phone calls, and texts. We sincerely appreciate it.

Aloha friends and family! I‚Äôm sure you have all heard about the horrible fires on Maui. My little brother Greg Lynch and his wife Dani have lost everything! I want to help the whole community but I have to help my family first then we can work on the community! This natural disaster has definitely devastated Maui and Big island. But let‚Äôs ban together to help this cocoa beach native to get thru these hard times. These funds will be used for shelter and potential help regain some things lost by the fire. Anything thing you can do to help with be much appreciated. Thanks for help in advance

My friend and Elder/Auntie, Apela Colorado lost her husband suddenly recently and this week lost everything in the Hawaiian fires. Read more about Apela Colorado's selfless service to the world: https: //earth institute.net/about-us/apela-colorado/. ALL of the money will be given directly to Apela Colorado and her family and community to heal from this devasting fire.

He lived in Lahaina and lost his home along with everything. He has lived on Maui for years and is a pillar in the Latin dance community here. He has been a dance teacher and active community member! He goes by Chapi to most people

On August 9th, our dear friends Melissa, Dave, their roommates Nic and Thorpe, and their dogs Pua, Chilly and kitty Tako became victims of the devastating fires on Maui, Hawaii. They live in the heart of Lahaina where Dave, Nic, and Thorpe worked at Waikiki Brewing on Front Street. Dave was the executive head chef there, putting his heart and soul into creating the menu from the ground up, and embracing the island foods while adding his own Colorado flare. It was a labor of love that was caught in this horrific event on Wednesday. Melissa has lived on the islands for over ten years and currently works with the Maui, Molokai, and Lanai schools in special education with an emphasis in working with deaf and hard of hearing children often traveling between all three islands. If you know these two, you are aware of how they embody aloha. Friends for almost 20 years, I‚Äôve worked with Melissa, lived with her, and she has become an auntie to my children and pets. They are the kindest and most deserving individuals we know and she would give the shirt off her back for a friend or stranger. Now that they need our help, it‚Äôs time to give all that we can to help them get back on their feet and get back to work. Our hearts are broken but we know that this community can come together and rebuild. All funds raised will be given directly to Melissa, Dave, Nic and Thorpe to rebuild their lives and get their animals to safety. Mahalo.

Hey guys, I‚Äôm Robert, not quite sure how start this, it‚Äôs just crazy how things went through in only a couple days. Amelia was supposed to finish her second week at pre-k, Mel was just about to go to work and I was just enjoying my ‚ÄúSunday‚Äù and then‚Ä¶ No power, no phone service, no nothing. At first we were kind of happy (no school means family day and we‚Äôd like to grab those opportunities every time they appear, so it was time for some monopoly and tacos, and then we smell the smoke, and everything just flipped. To be able to describe our exodus (and I use biblical words because it‚Äôs was really biblical) I would have to remember and right now the best thing is moving forward. We‚Äôre safe thank god, with health and most important part we‚Äôre together. Now as we tried to recoup and balance our wins and looses we just realized that we might be out of resources kind of quick. So like my dad use to said: it takes courage to be able to realize that sometimes you need help, and even more courage to ask for it.

On August 8, 2023, my hometown in Lahaina, Maui faced the most devastating fire and hurricane that the town had ever experienced. My mom, dad & stepmom lost their homes and vehicles. I humbly ask for any donation in hopes of helping them get back on their feet. Any amount of help will be greatly appreciated. Our prayers are with all the families that were affected by this tragedy. My mom lived on lahainaluna road and my dad in kahoma.

On August 8th, hurricane-strength winds helped fuel a deadly fire that burned down almost the entirety of Lahaina town. Many homes, businesses and lives were lost. Our store on Front Street as well as our warehouse with all of our inventory burned down to the ground. A few of our employees lost not only their place of work but also their homes with all of their belongings. The money raised by this campaign will be donated directly to our employees in need to purchase basic necessities and to help them get back on their feet after this catastrophic event.

Aloha my name is Amy Sanchez, I am starting this go fund me to raise money for our children. Not for me or my other half. We are one of the many families who have lost our homes to the tragic fire in lahaina. We can't go to our parents homes either because they also lost their homes. We are hoping to at least get money for our children as we have our 6 year old son Asher with downsyndrome, hypotonia, and oxygen dependent with seizures who we will be needing to replace his medical equipment, clothing, footwear that we lost in the fire if we cannot get insurance to help us with his medical equipment. We also ask for our Twin girls Stella and Luna age 5 who we will also need to buy school supplies and clothing, footwear. And most inpostantly food and drinking water. Any help even if it's a dollar will greatly help us get what our children need until we figure out what our other next steps to take will be. I truly thank you all for any monetary donation or even for just sharing our gofundme. Thank you truly and we greatly appreciate it. I am still in shock as I keep thinking I'll wake up from this horrible dream and be able to go home but remembering there is nothing but Ashes. Mahalo and many blessings for you all and everyone else in our community.

Hi Everyone, Our parents are residents of Lahaina and thankfully they are safe. Although, they lost their home and all their possessions due to the fire that devested the Lahaina community. They left our childhood home with just their three dogs and need assistance to help them get back on their feet. Funds will be transferred to our parents and any help is appreciated! Thank You! Elizabeth, Judel, Mychael and Kat

Like many others, the homes of both the Estabillo and Balmores families were in the path of destruction, forcing them to flee for their lives. We are deeply grateful that my grandparents, parents, three siblings, their pets, as well as my aunt, uncle, and their three children, are safe. However, they now find themselves relying on temporary shelters. Compounding the urgency of their situation, my grandparents suffer from COPD. My grandmother requires oxygen 24/7, making their displacement not just a matter of shelter but also a serious health concern. While I currently reside outside the disaster-stricken area and feel a profound sense of helplessness due to the distance, I am determined to do everything within my power to help. I, Maricris, am reaching out on behalf of the Estabillo and Balmores families to humbly request any monetary support you can offer. This will directly assist in supporting their immediate needs, ensuring my grandmother's health requirements are met, and in the eventual rebuilding of their homes. Every act of generosity, no matter the size, is deeply appreciated.

Aloha, my name is Cristel and I am fundraising for my family. My whole family and I lost our home during the Lahaina Fire. We lost our home, but not our Hope. It is still heart-breaking every time we think about it but we have to remain strong as a family and as a community. It took us 20years to finally be able to purchase our own home that we can call our own. But within just two years of making our memories there, it was taken by the Lahaina fire. I know many families lost their home too, that is why any amount will do. Just something to get us through. We appreciate all your financial support, prayers and encouragement. Mahalo Nui Loa. GOD bless Lahaina!

Hi, my name is Heather. My aunty Sally, uncles Prudencio & Fernando and cousins, Stef, Jason & Samantha lost their home in Lahaina, Maui during the brush fire on 8/8/2023. They evacuated from their home which was engulfed in flames to the Lahaina Civic center. Then ordered to evacuate once more to Napili park. With no to very little resources left. And signal on their cellphones. They decided that once the road opens back up, that they'll make their way back to Kahului & wailuku. My cousin Samantha called me as soon as they reached Maalaea. She asked if they can come to my house. And without hesitation I said come!!! And with the grace of god they are all accounted for and safe. They've lived and serviced Lahaina, Maui for more than 23 years. Proud church members. They are people that give and expect nothing in return. They are left without a home to return to. Please help them recover and heal from this devastating loss. Anything helps all funds will be used to help recover from being displaced during this difficult time.
Elaine and Glenn are both safe but they lost everything in the fire including their 2 Fur babies. Anything is greatly appreciated!!

On August 8th, my family and many other families from my hometown of Lahaina, Maui, HI, experienced the brutal Maui wild fires during hurricane Dora. A plea from Cheri's mom, Davalynn: "Cheri is a tenacious, strong, kind hearted fighter with a beautiful spirit. She does not want to leave Maui. She said, ‚ÄòI can't leave here. So many people need help. This is my home and I want to stay and help rebuild.‚Äô Ashes to ashes, dust to dust. Please help Cheri to realize her next dream, rebuilding."

Hey guys, if you know me then you know this is the last thing I want to do.. But If you are able to, please help my family get back on their feet. They have lost everything in the fire. Carla, Peter's mom, reported that Peter deAquino's house and vehicles were saved, but Sterling Seaton's house burned down with all his possessions, his girlfriend Kristina's car, and their beloved cat. My friends Theresa and Hannah lost their home in the Lahaina fire. They only had time to grab their cat before evacuating. Please show them some love and support if you feel called

Lani, and her mom, our beloved Aunty Noni. They live in Lahaina and by a miracle, have survived the devastating fire that destroyed their community. community. From what I understand so far, they tried to get out in their vehicle but couldn't because the roads were impassable. They had to make the unimaginable decision to abandon the vehicle and head for the water. With help, they were able to get Aunty, who uses a wheelchair/walker, up and over the wall, across the rocks, and into the water. These two strong whine spent somewhere around 7 hours in the water before being rescued. I don't have all the details but I do know they have lost everything, including their vehicle, their home, and Lani's entire business @paiki_hawaii.
We are a family of 10 that lived in Wahikuli. We lost everything.

Aloha my name is sanoe I‚Äôm asking for help for my ohana who was one of many who has lost everything due to the fire in Lahaina ,Maui we have lived in Lahaina for all our lives and within minutes we have lost everything our home some of our pets and everything we had to welcome my new grand baby who is due in 8 weeks our family is beyond devastated like many we were forced to leave with only the clothes on our backs and are desperate for help so I ask for your help whatever it is you can help so that we can find a home to rent

As you may have seen, there was a devastated fire that hit Lahaina. Our family, coach Pedro, Rafa, Alana, and Mila have lost our home, business material, surfboards, 2 cars, and all our belongings. Hi, my name is Joenalyn and I'm starting this fundraiser for my family members who have suffered much loss in the recent Lahaina fire. Three separate homes were lost in this tragic event, one belonging to my sister and the other two homes succumbed by the fire belonging to two of my nephews. I cannot even begin to imagine what it would feel like to lose everything that you've worked so hard for in the blink of an eye and irreplaceable personal items turned into ashes. We are reaching out to friends and family on behalf of the Boote family to help us raise funds in which to support them during this extremely challenging and surreal time. We are hopeful that we can come together to assist with immediate and essential needs, such as temporary housing, clothing, and food. While they grieve the loss of the lovely community they were a part of, they will have much to navigate as they plan for the next steps of rebuilding their lives from scratch.

My Aunty Lita (my mom‚Äôs sister) and Uncle Bert were so very blessed to have made it out of the fires. In a panicked effort to reach safe grounds, they ran and evacuated their home on foot with ONLY the clothes on them. They made their way down the hill of Lahainaluna Road on foot, with the flames and heavy thick smoke surrounding them on both sides. It was only towards the bottom, a very generous couple (to whom there will never be enough words to express how forever grateful my family is to you) let them into their vehicle and led them to safety. After when everything is said and done, my Aunty and uncle will have nothing to go back to; their working place, which also was lost to the fire, but more importantly, a home. The house they called home was home to many other families who rented, most of whom didn‚Äôt even know what renters insurance was. So there will be NO ASSISTANCE from insurance whatsoever to help with the cost of temporary housing or the cost of replacing anything.

Aloha everyone. My name is Sammy Biado and just like everyone that resides in the Historic Lahaina Town.. we lost everything, like many, many others. Your generosity is welcomed but not obligated.. anything helps to get me and my family in a more secure financial place. Thank you from the upmost of our hearts.. Sammy & Hazzel Biado ‚ù§Ô∏è

Please join us in helping Jojo and Eliza Vasquez and their family rebuild their lives on Maui. My dear brother Mark, his wife LiAnne, and their two boys Emmett (6 yrs) and Finn (3 yrs) lost everything in the Lahaina fire on August 8th. Hi, my name is Gina. I am fundraising to help my family who lost everything due to the fires in Maui, Hawaii. They lived right in the heart of Lahaina, a few blocks from Front Street. Lahaina resident, Lahainaluna wrestling Coach, community leader, Kumulani member, and local surf shop owner of Hi-tech Kim Ball and his wife, Cindy, tragically lost their home in the recent Lahaina fire. While they are so grateful that their family is safe and accounted for, now comes the daunting task of rebuilding their homes and reestablishing their deep roots in the Lahaina community. Kim has always been there for his community, on the water, in his shops, at the schools, at surf competitions, at his church, and all over this island‚Äîand he would never ask for anything, but their ohana needs our support.

Hi everyone, we have been greatly affected by the Lahaina wildfire. No words can describe the devastation we are all going through. We are completely heartbroken by this tragic event. I am one of the many people in my community who has lost our homes. Sheri, Kainoa, and Kahealani (Lani girl) have been living in Maui for the past 30 years, and both Kainoa and Lani were born and raised on the islands. All their life, Maui has been home. My name is Branden Aoki and I am from Lahaina, Hawaii. I am fundraising for my mom and stepdad, Helene Kauhaahaa-Pali and Eric Pali. description: I am making this GoFundMe on behalf of my family because we lost our home and family business in the recent fire disaster in Lahaina. We were forced to leave our belongings, evacuate our home, and watch our home and family business burn into the ground with the rest of Front Street town. As a result of this tragedy, we would greatly appreciate donations of any amount so that my dad (Tien Doan), mom (Amy Doan), brother (Patrick Doan), sister (Celine Doan), and I can get back on our feet. We know that the Maui community will come together to rebuild Lahaina town very soon but until then, I would greatly appreciate it if you could share this post. If you are unable to donate, all I ask is that you pray for the Maui community during this time of loss and healing.

As the wildfire spread throughout Lahaina, my grandparents, parents, and my mom's sister's family evacuated our home with nothing but the clothes on their backs, important documents, and a few baby pictures. With my family's permission, I created this GoFundMe to better assist them. I know there are so many families affected by the fire but every little bit will be of huge help, whether it goes to clean water and nonperishable goods or to helping rebuild when the time comes.

The aftermath of this tragedy has brought immense sorrow and helplessness, especially as my childhood home which has been passed down through generations was among those lost to the flames. The funds raised will go towards helping my parents as they navigate the challenges of rebuilding, as well as supporting my other family members who have been affected.

My name is Vanessa Castillo, I am 1 of 3 children. I am the daughter of Ave and Noble Castillo. I have 2 brothers, Symere and JR. We live in Lahaina, specifically in the Wahikuli neighborhood, on Kahoma street. We are fundraising to get our life back together. I appreciate all of you and your generosity and thank you for your support. 48 hours ago I could only empathize but never imagined my life would be taken away from me like this. If I had one more moment in my home with my family, what would I have done? I would have had watched my dad enjoy one more beer in the comfort of his own home while he listened to his favorite country music or singing Karaoke and bbq on his grill. I would have praised my moms hard work as she finished a day of gardening. Her garden meant everything to her. I would had cherish her smile one last time, as she walked through her garden after a stressful day of work. I would have encouraged my dad to paint the porch, that he was working so hard to finish. I would have taken a longer look at the photos of my grandparents and reminisced on my childhood. I would have scanned the room and taken in the memories and love that was built in that home. OUR home.
